unit_learning_outcomes.description: Apply knowledge of the NSW Stage 6 Geography syllabus to design, implement and evaluate lesson sequences.
Prepare for and contribute to discussions and debates about geographical education.
Employ evidence-based approaches to assess student achievement of learning outcomes.
Demonstrate in-depth, broad and coherent knowledge of students' varied backgrounds and abilities and cater for these needs through differentiation.
Apply research evidence to critically reflect on and improve teaching practice.
Demonstrate in-depth, broad and coherent knowledge of the philosophy, structure, content and inquiry-based methodologies of the NSW Stage 6 Geography syllabus.

assessments.description: Students identify core concepts, common student misunderstandings, relevant contemporary resources, appropriate instructional strategies and representations. Students provide a rationale for the instructional approach based on the relevant literature (500 words).
Students evaluate the suitability of a learning and teaching program for a hypothetical cohort of students and adapt the program to better suit studentsâ€™ needs. Include a rationale (500 words)

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: EDST8233 - Teaching Geography in the Secondary School 2
data.description: This unit focuses on the teaching of Geography in Years 11 and 12 and is an extension of EDST8232. Students develop and integrate an in-depth, broad and coherent knowledge of the Stage 6 curriculum and Geography's inquiry-based methodologies (applying geographic skills, investigating contemporary issues and conducting fieldwork). This unit is closely aligned with EDST8240 (Professional Practice III).
